pullRequest.body:
Add a new --check flag to `mk_all`: if true, only verify the files are correct,
and print an error (with instructions how to update the file) if not.
CI can use this to give an error if the files are wrong.

(Another possibility is to automatically update the files instead: this is left for future PRs.) 

---

~~It might be worth not merging this PR yet, as `mk_all` seems to not work on Windows, for reasons not related to the script.~~ IIRC, this issue is understood now - was it fixed already?

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

nodes.body:
### PR summary [898fb0e68d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13617/commits/898fb0e68d14e0f21b8e33e90494e7da9ac15df8)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Follow-up to #11874: let me CC @adomani.

There was a recent new contributor (I don't remember the name or PR right now) who got stuck at the "import all files" step. I'm hoping this error would have been more helpful.

Btw, there is another CI step that also builds `Archive`, `Counterexamples`, `Mathlib/Tactic`: would it make sense to use `--check` there as well?  It is not clear to me how the `check` interacts with multiple libraries.
Note that before a recent refactor, we were getting nice github suggestions that allowed us to click a button to add a missing line.

> Btw, there is another CI step that also builds `Archive`, `Counterexamples`, `Mathlib/Tactic`: would it make sense to use `--check` there as well? It is not clear to me how the `check` interacts with multiple libraries.

Good suggestion! I have added `--check` there as well.
This flag looks at every file this is out of date (not just the first one --- I implemented this and also tested it locally), so this seems safe.

> Note that before a recent refactor, we were getting nice github suggestions that allowed us to click a button to add a missing line.

I remember! But wasn't the issue that these suggestions were too often off by one, generating a non-sorted file?
bors d+

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the review (also in the other PRs)!
bors r+

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9642845609/job/26591548475)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9643518818/job/26593684897)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9643518818/job/26593685463)
I could not check it at a computer, but looks good to me, thanks!
I could not check it at a computer, but looks good to me, thanks!

```suggestion
        IO.println s!"File '{fileName}' does not exist"
```

```suggestion
        IO.println s!"The file '{fileName}' is out of date: run `lake exe mk_all{if git then " --git" else ""}` to update it"
```
(untested)

I would prefer *not* to do this: the `--check` flag is meant to be passed in during CI only, and CI only runs on the CI output (which equals the local output). So, I'd tend to recommend the simplest thing which works, and I guess that is this one.

... a moment later I realised that this line really does - it doesn't seem to hurt either. (It only prints --git if the user specified this manually, in which case mentioning the flag will not be confusing.) I've included it now.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: polish user experience with the check of import-only files
